results.title: The House of exorcism = Lisa and the devil
results.creator_credit: Mario Bava, Mickey Lion and Leone International Film
results.brief_description: Originally filmed as ‘Lisa and the Devil’, Mario Bava’s creepy and atmospheric chiller was re-cut for the American market, with a demonic possession sub-plot (directed by Mickey Lion), added to capitalise on the success of ‘The Exorcist’. As it stands now this rather disjointed film stars Elke Sommers as Lisa, a woman holidaying in an unspecified European city. Along her travels she begins to notice a strange man (Telly Savalas, sporting his trademark chuppa-chup) following her, who carries around with him a creepy life like mannequin who may or may not be Satan. Lisa suddenly begins to convulse and is rushed off to hospital. Her condition is soon diagnosed as demonic possession (vomiting, profanity, etc.) and a priest (Robert Alda) is brought in to help. These scenes are intercut with strange dream-like sequences of Lisa in an unspecified gothic mansion, where a mentally disturbed man (Alessio Orano) lives with his blind mother and their butler (Savalas again), who may or may not be Satan. Also known as: ‘La casa dell’esorcismo’, ‘Lisa and the Devil’, ‘The devil in the house of exorcism’, and ‘The devil and the dead’. Cast also includes Alida Valli and Sylva Koscina.

results.title: The Icicle thief
results.creator_credit: Maurizio Nichetti, Aries Film and Bambu
results.brief_description: In his ingenious comedy, Nichetti has takena wide-eyed look at Italian cinema, past and present, and has staggered back from the vision, his mind brimming with invention. On one hand, there’s Italy’s hallowed neo-realist past; grainy, black-and-white postwar images full of stubbled, unemployed fathers, sacrficial mothers and brave bustling priests. On the other, there are the television shows that “present” these films: a wasteland of lofty critics, only too willing to interpret a director’s deepest motives and intentions- even to the director himself. Nichetti has created a hilarious movie that mixes the world of cinema and television into a comic masterpiece.

results.title: The Iced hopes of Dr Calastein
results.creator_credit: Bruce Currie, Hobart Hughes and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Calestein returns to his underground laboratory to continue work on his beloved virus. A day not unlike any other and yet today is different. Somehow things have gone to far, and those outside and above think its time to have a few words with Dr Calestein.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Currie, Hobart Hughes and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative

results.title: The Icecream treaty
results.brief_description: The Antarctic Treaty’s aim is to protect the frozen continent whilst allowing peaceful scientific research. Due to renegotiation in 1991, the seven claimants face increasing pressure from a world hungry for the Antarctic’s riches. This video looks at how the people from many countries working there survive in the harsh but stunning surroundings.

results.title: The Hunger
results.brief_description: The Hunger seamlessly melds gothic horror with a chic, contemporary edge in this erotic tale of sex, blood and desire. The icily beautiful vampire Miriam (Catherine Deneuve) and her latest consort, John (David Bowie), spend their nights scanning the hottest nightclubs in New York for new prey. When John suddenly begins to age at an alarming rate, they seek out Sarah Roberts (Susan Sarandon), a doctor researching links between blood disease and ageing. Disbelieving at first, Sarah rapidly becomes enmeshed in the nightmarish reality of Miriam’s world. Based upon the novel of the same name by best-selling author Whitley Strieber.

results.title: The Hunchback of Notre-Dame = Notre Dame de Paris
results.creator_credit: Jean Delannoy, Betty Edmonds, Raymond Hakim, Robert Edmonds, Allied Artists Pictures and Cocinor
results.brief_description: Anthony Quinn plays the deformed hunchbacked bell-ringer Quasimodo and Gina Lollobrigida stars as the beautiful gypsy dancing girl Esmeralda in this French/Italian adaptation of Victor Hugo’s all-time classic novel about friendship, love and loyalty. Lavish sets, costume and make-up, along with a cast of thousands, are used to create a historical epic in the style of such films as “The Ten commandments” and “Ben Hur”, but unfortunately does not quite succeed in the same way that these films did. The dialogue at times is perhaps overdone and the film comes across more as a theatrical presentation, lacking a sense of realism. However this is not to take away from Anthony Quinn and Gina Lollobrigida’s solid performances in their respective roles. Cast also includes Alaine Cuny, Jean Danet, Robert Hirsch, Danielle Dumont, Philippe Clay. NOTE: This film is partially dubbed.

results.title: The Hottest show on earth
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, Jeffrey Schon, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A humourous film on the subject of home insulation. Topics include: the origins of fossil fuels, how to optimise furnace efficiency, common areas of home heat loss, weather-stripping and insulation. Narrated by David Suzuki.

results.title: The Human face [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David Stewart, James Erskine and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Comedian John Cleese and actor/model Liz Hurley present this BBC television documentary series exploring the dimensions of the human face, including its creation, function, sexuality, communication, identity and perception. Also features appearances by Michael Palin, Pierce Brosnan, Joan Rivers, Candice Bergen and David Attenborough. The four parts to the series are ‘Face to Face’, ‘Here’s Looking at You!’, ‘Beauty’ and ‘Fame’.

results.title: The Human animal: a personal view of the human species. Part 2 (X)
results.creator_credit: Graham Booth, Martin Weitz, Mike Beynon and BBC
results.brief_description: Desmond Morris examines the ways in which human beings behave in terms of our “animal” instincts. The three episodes are: “The Biology of love” which is a scientific and biological approach to aspects of human love, courtship and sexuality. “The Immortal genes” examines human life from babyhood in terms of the Life Cycle. “Beyond survival” focuses on aspects of behaviour exhibited by human beings beyond those required for survival; in particular creativity and imagination. NB: Features full frontal nudity and specific scenes of sexual intercourse.

results.title: The Housewife
results.creator_credit: Cathy Bennett, Guy Glover, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study, in film animation, of a day in the life of a housewife, described without words, with a minimum of detail but with a perception all the more pertinent because of the simplicity of presentation. The film makes no judgments. It simply states the case, but serves as an apt starting point for any discussion of the role of women and the value of their work. (Award: Hilversun.)
